arm_group.description: Subjects with first Myocardial Infarction presenting to one of the Mayo Clinic Hospitals in Rochester, Minnesota.

brief_summary.textblock:
To comprehensively characterize Left Ventricular (LV) remodeling after Myocardial Infarction
      (MI) in the community, study the association between patterns of remodeling and biological
      pathways and examine the association between the predictors of remodeling and heart failure
      after Myocardial Infarction.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ventricular Remodeling and Heart Failure After Myocardial Infarction: A Community Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Hospitalized patients with a clinical diagnosis of Myocardial Infarction.

          2. Residents of Olmsted, Dodge, Goodhue, Wabasha, Winona, Fillmore and Mower Counties.

          3. Able to provide informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Previous clinical diagnosis of Myocardial Infarction

          2. Previous diagnosis of Heart Failure and/or Cardiomyopathy

          3. Diagnosis of Apical Ballooning Syndrome

          4. Planned Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) during index hospitalization

          5. Unable to provide informed consent

study_pop.textblock:
Subjects in the 7 County area who are admitted to the Mayo Clinic Hospitals in Rochester,
        Minnesota who have their first myocardial infarction and are willing to have blood drawn
        and return for an echocardiogram in 3 months.

clinical_study.official_title: Ventricular Remodeling and Heart Failure After Myocardial Infarction: A Community Study

primary_outcome.description: Development of Heart Failure  post Myocardial Infarction

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: All cause mortality post Myocardial Infarction

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Ecologic or Community, Time Perspective: Prospective
